messages.content: How can one install ComfyUI ProPost?

The easiest way to install ComfyUI ProPost is using the ComfyUI Manager by searching for 'propost' and clicking install. Alternatively, one can manually install by navigating to the '/ComfyUI/custom_nodes/' folder, running 'git clone https://github.com/digitaljohn/comfyui-propost.git', 'pip install -r requirements.txt', and restarting ComfyUI.
What nodes are available in ComfyUI ProPost?
Currently, ComfyUI ProPost offers five nodes: Film Grain, Vignette, Radial Blur, Depth Map Blur, and Apply LUT.
What parameters does the Film Grain node have?
The Film Grain node has parameters like gray_scale, grain_type, grain_sat, grain_power, shadows, highs, scale, sharpen, src_gamma, and seed.
How can one control the intensity of the vignette effect?
The intensity of the vignette effect in the Vignette node can be controlled via the 'intensity' parameter, with a range of 0.0 to 10.0.
What options are available in the Radial Blur node?
The Radial Blur node includes options like blur_strength, center_x, center_y, focus_spread, and steps.
What are the parameters to control the blur based on depth map?
The Depth Map Blur node has parameters like depth_map, blur_strength, focal_depth, focus_spread, and steps.
How can one apply a 3D LUT to the image using Apply LUT node?

The Apply LUT node allows the application of a 3D LUT to the image by selecting the '.cube' file from the 'luts' folder with the 'lut_name' parameter and controlling the strength of the LUT effect via the 'strength' parameter.
